channel.title: Regulatory Information By Sector
channel.description: Updated Regulatory Information By Sector content from the US Environmental Protection Agency

item.title: NAICS Sector 92: Public Administration
item.description:
The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has many regulations that affect industries within the public administration sector. The links below correspond to the public administration industries EPA regulations affect, with their North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code. On those pages you can find a list of laws and regulations that affect your industry as well as compliance and enforcement information.

  • American Indian & Alaska Native Tribal Governments (NAICS 921150)
  • Federal Facilities (NAICS 921110)
  • International Affairs (NAICS 928120)
  • Local Governments: Executive Offices (NAICS 921110)
item.dc:creator: dbhagat

item.title: NAICS Sectors 31-33: Manufacturing
item.description:
The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has many regulations that affect industries within the manufacturing sector. The links below correspond to the various manufacturing industries EPA regulations affect, with their North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code. On those pages you can find a list of laws and regulations that affect your industry as well as compliance and enforcement information.

  • Aerospace (NAICS 332 & 336)
  • Chemical Manufacturing (NAICS 325)
  • Computer and Electronic Products (NAICS 334)
  • Food Processing (NAICS 311)
  • Furniture Manufacturing (NAICS 337)
  • Metals: Primary (NAICS 331) and Fabricated (NAICS 332)
  • Mineral Processing: Nonmetallic (NAICS 327)
  • Petroleum (NAICS 324)
  • Pharmaceutical and Medicine (NAICS 3254)
  • Plastics and Rubber Products (NAICS 326)
  • Printing and Related Support Activities (NAICS 323)
  • Ship and Boat Building (NAICS 3336)
  • Textile Manufacturing (NAICS 313)
  • Wood Product and Paper (NAICS 321 & 322)
item.dc:creator: dbhagat

item.title: Water and Sewage Utilities Sector (NAICS 2213)
item.description:
Drinking and wastewater operation and treatment facilities are part the utilities sector (NAICS 22). Industries in this sector include water treatment plants, water supply systems, sewer systems, and/or sewage treatment facilities that collect, treat, and dispose of waste. 

Laws and Regulations

  • Drinking Water Treatment Wastes
  • Effluent Guidelines: Drinking Water Treatment Residuals Management
  • Municipalities and Wastewater Treatment Plants
  • NESHAP for Publicly Owned Treatment Works (POTW)
  • Public Drinking Water Systems Programs
  • Pretreament Program

Compliance

  • Pretreatment of Wastewater (Industrial Users) Compliance Monitoring
  • Small Systems and Capacity Development: Compliance Help
  • Laboratories & Monitoring
  • Protocol for Conducting Environmental Compliance Audits of Public Water Systems under the Safe Drinking Water Act (SDWA) (PDF) (3/1/00)

Enforcement

  • Water Enforcement

Policy & Guidance

  • Municipalities and Wastewater Treatment Plants Policy and Guidance Documents
  • Water Enforcement Policy, Guidance, and Publications
item.dc:creator: dbhagat

item.title: Computer and Electronic Product Manufacturing Sector (NAICS 334)
item.description:
Computer and Electronic Product Manufacturing is part of the manufacturing sector (NAICS 31 - 33). This sector covers manufacturers of electrical distribution equipment, household appliances, communications equipment, electrical industrial apparatus, radio and television receiving equipment and other electrical equipment and supplies.

Laws and Regulations

  • Greenhouse Gas Reporting Program
  • National Emissions Standards for Hazardous Air Pollutants (NESHAP): air toxics regulations:
    • Degreasing Organic Cleaners (Halogenated Solvent Cleaners)
    • Magnetic Tape (surface coating)
    • Semiconductor Manufacturing
  • Stratospheric Ozone Regulations:
    • The Phaseout of Ozone Depleting Substances
    • Significant New Alternatives Policy (SNAP) Program: EPA's program to evaluate and regulate substitutes for the ozone-depleting chemicals.

Policies and Guidance

  • Protocol for Conducting Environmental Compliance, Audits of Treatment, Storage and Disposal Facilities under the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA)
item.dc:creator: dbhagat

item.title: Electric Power Generation, Transmission and Distribution (NAICS 2211)
item.description:
Electric power generation, transmission and distribution are part of the utilities sector (NAICS 22). This sector includes all electric generating facilities powered by fossil fuels, including coal, petroleum, or gas as the power source.

Additional regulatory information about this sector may be available from the US Department of Energy.

Laws and Regulations

  • Air:
    • Cleaner Power Plants: controlling mercury and other hazardous air pollutants from power plants.
    • Interstate Air Pollution Transport
    • National Emissions Standards for Hazardous Air Pollutants (NESHAP): air toxics regulations:
      • Air Toxics Standards for Utilities
      • Benzene Waste Operations
      • Stationary Internal Combustion Engines, includes information about Reciprocating Internal Combustion Engines (RICE)
      • Stationary Combustion Turbines
    • Greenhouse Gas Reporting Program
    • Mercury and Air Toxics Standards (MATS): Regulatory Actions
  • Waste:
    • Industrial Waste: Fossil Fuel Combustion Waste
  • Water:
    • Cooling Water Intake Structures: CWA §316(b): Final rules, court proceedings, and other documents related to the National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) rules for cooling water intake structures.
    • Steam Electric Power Generating Effluent Guidelines

Compliance

  • Combustion Portal Exit: compliance assistance center.
  • Industrial Materials Recycling: Coal Combustion Products

Enforcement

  • National Enforcement Initiatives:
    • Ensuring Energy Extraction Sector Compliance with Environmental Laws
    • Reducing Air Pollution from the Largest Sources
item.dc:creator: dbhagat

item.title: Local Governments (Executive Offices) Sector (NAICS 921110)
item.description:
Part of the larger public administration sector (NAICS 92), this sector consists of units of local government that must comply with environmental requirements during their daily operations and while providing services to their residents.

Laws and Regulations

  • Air
    • Greenhouse Gas Reporting Program
    • National Emission Standards for Hazardous Air Pollutants (NESHAP): air toxics regulations:
      • Industrial, Commercial and Institutional Boilers and Process Heaters: Area & Major Sources
      • Publicly Owned Treatment Works (POTWs)
      • Municipal Solid Waste Landfill
    • State Implementation Plans Status and Information: how states and EPA work together to meet and maintain National Ambient Air Quality Standards.
  • Emergencies
    • Local Emergency Planning Committees
  • Water
    • Public Drinking Water Systems Programs
    • Effluent Guidelines: Drinking Water Treatment
    • National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES): wastewater permitting:
      • Municipalities and Wastewater Treatment Plants: includes stormwater and sewer overflow information.
    • Small Public Water Systems and Capacity Development
    • Wastewater in Small Communities

Compliance

  • Boiler Compliance at Area Sources
  • Combustion Portal Exit: compliance assistance center.
  • Local Government Compliance Assistance Exit: including sector profiles and compliance assistance centers.
  • TSCA Section 402/404: Lead-Based Paint Renovation Program: guidance to assist states and tribes to manage lead renovation, repair and painting programs.

Enforcement

  • State and Local Government Activities and Liability Protections: Cleanup of contaminated properties
item.dc:creator: dbhagat

item.title: Federal Facilities (Executive Offices) Sector (NAICS 921110)
item.description:
Federal facilities is part of the public administration sector (NAICS 92). The sector consists of establishments of federal, state, and local government agencies that administer, oversee, and manage public programs and have executive, legislative, or judicial authority over other institutions within a given area.

Laws and Regulations

  • Greenhouse Gas Reporting Program
  • Federal Facilities Restoration and Reuse: base closures and transfers, hazardous waste, military munitions, perchorlate, and other regulatory information.
  • National Emissions Standards for Hazardous Air Pollutants (NESHAPS): air toxics regulations:
    • Industrial, Commercial and Institutional Boilers and Process Heaters: Area & Major Sources
    • Municipal Solid Waste Landfills
  • Regulatory Radiation Information from Other Agencies

Compliance

  • Boiler Compliance at Area Sources
  • Combustion Portal Exit: compliance assistance center.
  • Comprehensive Procurement Guideline: purchasing products with recycled or recovered materials.
  • Sustainable Marketplace: Greener Products and Services: helps the federal government "buy green."
  • Federal Facilities Sector Compliance Assistance: including sector profiles and assistance centers.

Enforcement

  • Federal Facilities Enforcement

Policies and Guidance

  • Federal Facilities Enforcement Policies
item.dc:creator: dbhagat

item.title: Chemical Manufacturing Sector (NAICS 325)
item.description:
Chemical Manufacturing is part of the Manufacturing Sector (NAICS 31 - 33).  This sector covers the transformation of organic and inorganic raw materials by a chemical process and the formation of products.

Laws and Regulations

  • Air:
    • Greenhouse Gas Reporting Program
    • National Emission Standards for Hazardous Air Pollutants (NESHAP):
      • Benzene Waste Operations
      • Cellulose Products Manufacturing
      • Commercial Sterilizers
      • Ferromanganese and Silicomanganese Production (Ferroalloys, Major Sources)
      • Generic MACT (Acetal Resins, Hydrogen Floride, Polycarbonates Production, Acrylic/Modacrylic Fibers, Spandex Production, Carbon Black, and Ethylene Processes)
      • Hazardous Organic NESHAP (Synthetic Organic Chemical Manufacturing Industry)
      • Hydrochloric Acid Production (Fumed Silica Production)
      • Industrial Cooling Towers
      • Magnetic Tape (surface coating)
      • Mercury Cell Chlor-Alkali Plants
      • Misc. Coating Manufacturing
      • Misc. Organic Chemical Production and Processes (MON)
      • Organic Liquids Distribution (non-gasoline)
      • Pesticide Active Ingredient Production
      • Pharmaceuticals Production
      • Phosphoric Acid/Phosphate Fertilizers
      • Polyether Polyols Production
      • Polymers & Resins I (Butyl Rubber, Epichlorohydrin Elastomers, Ethylene Propylene Rubber, Hypalon (TM), Neoprene, Nitrile Butadiene, Polybutadiene Rubber, Polysulfide, and Styrene-Butadiene Rubber and Latex)
      • Polymers & Resins II (Epoxy Resins and Non-Nylon Polyamides)
      • Polymers & Resins III (Amino and Phenolic Resins)
      • Polymers & Resins IV (Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene, Methyl Methacrylate-Acrylonitrile+, Methyl Methacrylate-Butadiene++, Polystrene, Styrene Acrylonitrile, Polyethylene Terephthalate, and Nitrile Resins)
      • Polyvinyl Chloride and Copolymers Production & Area Sources
      • Primary Copper
      • Reinforced Plastic Composites Production
      • Site Remediation
      • Tetrahydrobenzaldehyde Manufacture (Formerly Butadiene Dimers Production)
    • Stratospheric Ozone Regulations:
      • The Phaseout of Ozone Depleting Substances
      • Significant New Alternatives Policy (SNAP) Program: EPA's program to evaluate and regulate substitutes for the ozone-depleting chemicals.
  • Toxic Substances:
    • Chemical Data Reporting under the Toxic Substances Control Act: requirements for manufacturers and processors of existing chemicals.
    • New Chemicals Program: chemicals new to the marketplace. Mandated by Section 5 of TSCA.
  • Water:
    • Organic Chemicals, Plastics, and Synthetic Fibers (OCPSF): effluent guidelines. 
    • Pesticide Chemicals Effluent Guidelines

Compliance

  • Chemical Manufacturing Sector Compliance Assistance: including industry profiles, compliance assistance centers, and more.
  • Combustion Portal Exit: compliance assistance center.

Enforcement

  • Reducing Widespread Air Pollution from the Largest Sources: National Enforcement Initiatives

Policies and Guidance

  • Compliance Guidance for Industrial Process Refrigeration Leak Repairs Regulations Under Section 608 Clean Air Act

Related Technical Information

  • AP 42 - Chapter 6: Organic Chemical Process Industry and Chapter 8: Inorganic Chemical Industry: emission factors and process information for air pollution source categories.
item.dc:creator: dbhagat

item.title: American Indian and Alaska Native Tribal Governments Sectors (NAICS 921150)
item.description:
Part of the larger public administration sector (NAICS 92), this sector comprises American Indian and Alaska Native governing bodies. Establishments in this industry perform legislative, judicial, and administrative functions for their American Indian and Alaska Native lands. Included in this industry are American Indian and Alaska Native councils, courts, and law enforcement bodies.

Laws and Regulations

  • American Indian Tribal Portal: Laws & Regulations
  • Drinking Water - Tribal Programs
  • Greenhouse Gas Reporting Program
  • National Emissions Standards for Hazardous Air Pollutants (NESHAPS):
    • Industrial, Commercial and Institutional Boilers and Process Heaters: Area & Major Sources
    • Municipal Solid Waste Landfills
  • Public Drinking Water System Programs

Compliance

  • Boiler Compliance at Area Sources
  • Combustion Portal Exit: compliance assistance center.
  • TSCA Section 402/404: Lead-Based Paint Renovation Program: guidance to assist states and tribes to manage lead renovation, repair and painting programs.
item.dc:creator: dbhagat
